intro: Boerlagia, commonly known as the "Mexican morning glory," is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing vines that can reach lengths of several meters. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Boerlagia thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its seeds are dispersed by animals and can germinate quickly under suitable conditions.
